intro: Barleria longistyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Barleria longistyla prefers well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
